thread.title: Joe Biden Rallies With House Democrats In Defense Of Obamacare
thread.title_full: Joe Biden Rallies With House Democrats In Defense Of Obamacare

author: Andrew Kerr
title: Joe Biden Rallies With House Democrats In Defense Of Obamacare
text:
Joe Biden Rallies With House Democrats In Defense Of Obamacare "Let me cut to the chase ..." by Andrew Kerr March 22, 2017 at 9:01am Share on Facebook 645 Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
Former Vice President Joe Biden joined House Democrats at the Capitol Wednesday in a rally to defend Obamacare one day before the House votes to replace the controversial 2010 healthcare law. 
“I ain’t going anywhere, this is not going to pass,” Biden said of the GOP healthcare bill in his first major appearance since leaving office in January. 
House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi, D-Calif., invited the former vice president to the rally on the steps of the Capitol, which took place one day before the seventh anniversary of Obamacare’s passage, and one day before House Republicans vote to replace the law. Advertisement - story continues below 
WATCH LIVE: Joe Biden leads Democrats in a rally to save ObamaCare one day before the House votes on repeal. 
Posted by The Hill on Wednesday, March 22, 2017 
When he took the podium, Biden spoke of the moment he and former President Barack Obama finalized the text of Obamacare, and the impact he believed the law would have on everyday Americans. 
“This bill was about peace of mind for Americans to finally, finally, finally, finally be able to lie there and know that God forbid something happens like has happened to [an] awful lot of us, that, ‘I’m not going to lose my house. I’m not going to lose everything. I’m not going to leave my family in distress,’” Biden said. Advertisement - story continues below 
He continued by claiming that he and the president knew they had not signed a perfect bill, and that improvements would need to be made after Obamacare’s passage. 
“We know, just like when Social Security was passed, there’d have to be improvements made,” Biden said. “The improvements are all doable.” 
The former vice president rejected the need to replace Obamacare. He claimed the controversial plan has been “incredibly beneficial, not only by the way to individuals, but total health care cost in America.” 
Biden failed to mention that healthcare premiums for midlevel plans under the Affordable Care Act increased by an average of 25 percent in 2017 due to rising costs and insurance companies dropping out of the marketplace. Advertisement - story continues below
